info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 26 at 7:27PM CDT until March 28 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...
Aransas River Near Skidmore affecting Bee County.
For the Aransas River...including Skidmore...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Aransas River near Skidmore.
* WHEN...From late tonight to Friday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Major lowland flooding occurs. Crops are damaged and pastureland is flooded in the Poesta and Aransas Creek flood plains upstream.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage near midnight tonight to 19.4 feet midday Thursday. It will fall below flood stage early Friday morning then continue to fall below caution stage by midday Friday. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/crp.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO FRIDAY AFTERNOON
